q: the proposal. Mr Sergio Marchionne praised the Mirafiori workers for voting in favour of the labour reforms. He said they were standing up against "decline" and "extremism". This was notable in a country like Italy that has always been tied to the past and resistant to change, he said. Italian leaders and unionists had said that the result of the Mirafiori vote had implications far beyond the limits of Turin. its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. "Likewise," Sergio Marchionne said when asked about Carl-Peter Forster 's comments by reporters. That's why it's on the table and we're going to discuss it. Sergio Marchionne said in the next two to three years, Chrysler and Fiat could ultimately merge to form a single company, adding "for all I know it could be based here." But

"I am paying shyster rates," Sergio Marchionne said, noting that Chrysler had no choice in 2009 but to pay the high interest rates the government set as part of its$ 15 billion Chrysler bailout. We had no choice... I am going to pay the shyster loans. He called the loans "a thorn in my side."
